meanings.definition: Relating to or functioning as an auxin.
meanings.sent1: The auxinic effect of the plant hormone helped in the growth of the flower.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the auxinic properties of the new fertilizer.
meanings.sent3: The garden gnome mistakenly drank the auxinic potion and started glowing in the dark.
meanings.sent4: Her smile had an auxinic quality, brightening up the room like a ray of sunshine.
meanings.sent5: The auxinic nature of the soil made the plants thrive with vibrant colors.

meanings.sent1: The medication showed auxinic characteristics in promoting cell growth.
meanings.sent2: The new plant food had an auxinic formula that enhanced leaf development.
meanings.sent3: The chef's secret sauce had an auxinic taste that made everyone crave more.
meanings.sent4: His words had an auxinic effect on her, making her feel stronger and more confident.
meanings.sent5: The painting had an auxinic charm, drawing viewers in with its captivating colors.

meanings.definition: Pertaining to the growth-regulating hormone auxin.
meanings.sent1: The auxinic hormone played a crucial role in the plant's development.
meanings.sent2: The researcher discovered a new auxinic pathway in plant biology.
meanings.sent3: The superhero's cape was made of an auxinic fabric that helped him fly faster.
meanings.sent4: Her advice had an auxinic impact on his decision-making process.
meanings.sent5: The auxinic signal triggered the plant to start blooming with beautiful flowers.
